perturbation.original_text: Company warrants that the Products will be designed, manufactured, constructed, assembled and packaged in a workmanlike manner and that such Products shall be fully functional and fit for their intended purposes. Company further warrants that the Products sold hereunder shall be free from defects in design, materials and workmanship for a period of twenty-four (24) months after delivery to Distributor's end-user. The Company shall not be liable for defective Products, except as provided in this Agreement. The Distributor at all times shall comply with all requirements of the Magnuson-Moss Warranty-Federal Trade Commission Improvement Act and similar federal and state laws and regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: Company warrants that the Products will be designed, manufactured, constructed, assembled and packaged in a workmanlike manner and that such Products shall be fully functional and fit for their intended purposes. Company further warrants that the Products sold hereunder shall be free from defects in design, materials and workmanship for a period of twenty-four (24) months after delivery to Distributor's end-user. The Company shall not be liable for defective Products, except as provided in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the sentence 'The Distributor at all times shall comply with all requirements of the Magnuson-Moss Warranty-Federal Trade Commission Improvement Act and similar federal and state laws and regulations.' creates a potential violation of consumer protection laws. The Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act mandates certain disclosures and requirements regarding warranties for consumer products, and the distributor's explicit agreement to comply with it is important for upholding consumer rights.
perturbation.law_explanation: The modification removes the distributor's obligation to comply with the Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act. This act requires clear and conspicuous disclosure of warranty terms, and by removing the compliance clause, the agreement becomes less protective of consumer rights and potentially violates the Act's provisions regarding warranty information.

perturbation.original_text: Company will carry a reasonable amount of product liability insurance through a reasonably acceptable products liability insurance company and will name the Distributor as an additional insured under that policy. Company will make reasonable efforts to procure a policy, which is non-cancelable, except upon thirty (30) days, advance notice to the Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: Company will carry a reasonable amount of product liability insurance through a reasonably acceptable products liability insurance company.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'and will name the Distributor as an additional insured under that policy. Company will make reasonable efforts to procure a policy, which is non-cancelable, except upon thirty (30) days, advance notice to the Distributor.' removes a protective measure for the distributor and potentially violates the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under Illinois law. Without being named as an additional insured, the distributor has less protection against product liability claims related to the company's products, and removing the non-cancelable clause leaves the distributor vulnerable to sudden policy changes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing (Illinois law)
perturbation.law_citation: Illinois Pattern Jury Instructions, Civil, 700.00 Series, Contract Issues
perturbation.law_explanation: The removed text previously ensured the distributor was an additional insured under the product liability policy and that the policy was non-cancelable, protecting them from potential product-related lawsuits. By removing these clauses, the Company can change/cancel the policy without informing the Distributor, which can result in the Distributor incurring unexpected expenses or legal ramifications.

perturbation.original_text: Distributor shall submit written reports to the Company each quarter during the first year of the Term, commencing ninety (90) days after execution of this Agreement, describing its efforts, the potential customers it has approached and the status of its efforts.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor shall submit written reports to the Company each quarter during the first year of the Term, describing its efforts, the potential customers it has approached and the status of its efforts. The reports shall not be subject to any external review.
perturbation.explanation: Adding "The reports shall not be subject to any external review." restricts the distributor's ability to seek legal counsel in preparing and reviewing these reports, which may violate their right to legal representation. Illinois law guarantees the right to counsel, and this addition could be interpreted as an attempt to circumvent that right.
perturbation.law_explanation: The additional language attempts to restrict the distributor from seeking legal counsel in the preparation and review of these reports. While not explicitly forbidding legal advice, it creates a chilling effect and could be construed as limiting the distributor's access to legal assistance, thus potentially violating their right to counsel.
